citation.article-title: Phylogenetic characterization of a novel salt-tolerant Bacillus species: description of Bacillus dipsosauri sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Bacillus dipsosauri sp. nov.
Bacillus dipsosauri (dip. so. sau'ri, N.L. zool. name Dipsosaurus the desert iguana. N.L. gen. n. dipsosauri of the desert iguana, because first isolated from the nasal cavities thereof)
Cells from overnight cultures grown in TSB with 1 mol 1-1 KCl are Gram-positive, thin motile rods.
On TSB agar with 1 mol 1-1 KCl, spherical refractile spores are produced within swollen terminal sporangia.
Long filaments containing several endospores are sometimes observed.
Sporulation also occurs in liquid culture but less frequently.
Colonies after 2 d growth at 37°C on TSB agar are white, smooth but not mucoid, circular and 2 mm in diameter.
Grows well in TSB with 1 mol 1-1 KCI at temperatures from 28 to 50°C; optimum temperature for growth 45°C.
Optimum growth at pH 7.5, grows in 15% (w/v) NaCl.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Behaves as a strict aerobe in thioglycollate broth.
Grows both aerobically and anaerobically in media containing 1 mol 1-1 KNO3 or 0.1 mol 1-1 KNO2 as electron acceptor.
Weak acid production in phenol red fermentation broths containing glucose, sucrose, mannitol and dulcitol.
Starch, triacylglycerides, aesculin, o-nitrophenylgalactosidase and p-nitrophenylgalactoside are hydrolysed.
Gelatin is weakly hydrolysed but casein and urea are not hydrolysed.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
The cell wall peptidoglycan is of the direct linked m-Dpm (Alγ) type.
The mol% G + C content is 394.
Isolated from the nasal salt glands of a desert iguana (Dipsosaurus dorsalis).
The type strain of B. dipsosauri is DD1 ( = NCFB 3027).
